summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Gold Coast Federal Credit Union, demanding financial records for accounts associated with a specific member number from January 2003 to December 2004. The subpoena is part of an investigation into violations of federal sex trafficking and related statutes, and includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signs the cover letter requesting non-disclosure of the grand jury subpoena to Gold Coast Federal Credit Union as part of an official criminal investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena dated June 14, 2019, commanding the credit union to produce records and appear before the grand jury.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: Gold Coast Federal Credit Union is commanded to appear before the Grand Jury for the Southern District of New York to testify and give evidence regarding alleged violations of federal statutes.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to Gold Coast Federal Credit Union for financial records related to a specific member account.

locations: New York, New York (U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York)
West Palm Beach, FL 33416-6719 (Gold Coast Federal Credit Union address)
40 Foley Square, Room 220, New York, NY (United States Courthouse for grand jury appearance)
keyFacts: The subpoena targets financial records from Gold Coast Federal Credit Union for accounts associated with a specific member number from January 2003 to December 2004.

The investigation involves alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (attempt/conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), and 2422(b) (coercion/enticement for illegal sexual activity).
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests non-disclosure of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing grand jury investigation.
The subpoena demands comprehensive records including account applications, statements, signature cards, deposit/withdrawal items, and cancelled checks.
The document indicates the investigation is being conducted by a federal grand jury in the Southern District of New York, focusing on financial records from a Florida-based credit union.
